cluster_classes.class_description: Individuals and groups who receive, listen to, or engage with stories and urban legends, from specific listeners to global audiences.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: People who hear and reflect on urban legends; groups of listeners or readers captivated by urban legends.

members.entity_description: People who hear and reflect on urban legends and other stories.
Groups of listeners or readers who engage with and are captivated by urban legends.
Global population whose imagination and curiosity are captured by urban legends.
Worldwide collection of people who can receive urban legends via internet and social media.

cluster_classes.class_description: Narrative content such as stories and urban legends that are disseminated through various channels to different audiences.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: stories can be shared and disseminated at lightning speed, reaching a global audience ... around the world

members.entity_description: Narratives, including urban legends, that can be quickly shared online to many people.

args.new_description: Individuals and groups who receive, listen to, or engage with stories and urban legends, from specific listeners to the global audience.
args.justification: Refines the class name and description to explicitly match the scope of audiences for both stories and urban legends while aligning the class_group label with the shared domain of narrative dissemination and reception.

args.new_description: Narrative content, including stories and urban legends, that is disseminated through various channels to different audiences.
args.justification: Clarifies that the class covers narrative content (stories and urban legends) and harmonizes the class_group with the related audience class, making the content–audience relationship explicit at the schema level.

executed_decisions.new_description: Individuals and groups who receive, listen to, or engage with stories and urban legends, from specific listeners to the global audience.
executed_decisions.justification: Refines the class name and description to explicitly match the scope of audiences for both stories and urban legends while aligning the class_group label with the shared domain of narrative dissemination and reception.

executed_decisions.new_description: Narrative content, including stories and urban legends, that is disseminated through various channels to different audiences.
executed_decisions.justification: Clarifies that the class covers narrative content (stories and urban legends) and harmonizes the class_group with the related audience class, making the content–audience relationship explicit at the schema level.
